name: Single Signon For Virtual Machines
short_description: With every improvement in technology, even the normal user will have to use and work with several systems at a time. Each of these systems will require that the user remembers separate login credentials to gain access. This could be tiresome in many occasions. The Single Signon idea addresses this problem. A major advantage Single Signon [1] offers is in terms of improved user experience, better manageability and more stringent policies to safeguard security. Single Signon has seen a lot of implementations in the Web Services domain. Example: User can sign in to a common interface once, which will grant him direct access to several services housed within the interface.
summary: Single Signon For Virtual Machines (VMs) in an Administrative Domain
